Key Arguments: Concerns about who decides what constitutes misinformation and disinformation, suggesting it could lead to censorship.
Fear that guidelines on misinformation could change with each new government.
Personal experience during the COVID-19 pandemic where information sharing was restricted, impacting health choices.
Perception of misinformation by mainstream media, citing an example of a protest attendance being underreported.
Notable Quotes: Who decides what is and isn't disinformation & misinformation? It sounds more like censorship.
I am a firm NO to some random government backed agency deciding on what is and is not dis/misinformation.
